text.p: Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp said Monday it has appointed Jack Bovender Jr as president and chief operating officer, to succeed David Vandewater, who resigned last week during a federal investigation of Medicare fraud by the giant hospital chain.
The appointment follows a tumultuous week during which Columbia/HCA's chairman, Richard Scott, also resigned and three mid-level executives were indicted on fraud charges.
Bovender, 51, a former chief operating officer of Hospital Corp of America, will take up the new post immediately, the company said in a statement.
Bovender retired as the chief operating officer of HCA in 1994 when it was acquired by Columbia, the company added.

"I am committed to operating this company in a manner that promotes the highest moral and ethical standards," Bovender said. "This means creating and supporting an environment in which integrity, honesty, and trust are the hallmarks of the way we do business."
In addition, he said Columbia/HCA's management team would cooperate with the federal government and state governments to resolve "past issues concerning the operating practices" of the company.
